section.section:
The General Assembly finds that the State must have sustainable communities in order to:
preserve and protect the State's natural resources; and
achieve the State's economic growth, resource protection, and planning policy in § 5-7A-01 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.

text.section:
It is the intent of the General Assembly that the community legacy and neighborhood business development programs:
be used to create, enhance, support, and revitalize sustainable communities across the State; and
be coordinated with other State programs, such as the Sustainable Communities Tax Credit Program established under Title 5A, Subtitle 3 of the State Finance and Procurement Article, in order to maximize the State's investment in sustainable communities.
